trans-unit.source:
Attachments of some entries are missing data. This is a sign of database corruption, most likely by the last used app (%1$@). KeePassium will preserve the empty attachments, but cannot restore them. You should restore your database from a backup copy.
Missing attachments: %2$@
trans-unit.target:
Los adjuntos en algunas entradas no tienen datos. Esta es una señal de base de datos dañada, posiblemente causada por la última aplicación utilizada (%1$@). KeePassium dejará los datos adjuntos vacíos, pero no los puede restaurar. Debes restaurar la base de datos desde una copia de seguridad.
Faltan adjuntos: %2$@
trans-unit.note: A warning about missing attachments after loading the database. [lastUsedAppName: String, attachmentNames: String]

alt-trans.target:
Los adjuntos en algunas entradas no tienen datos. Este es una señal de daño en la base de datos, posiblemente causada por la última aplicación utilizada (%1$@). KeePassium dejará los datos adjuntos vacíos, pero no los puede restaurar. Debe restaurar su base de datos de una copia de seguridad.
Faltan adjuntos: %2$@

trans-unit.source:
Some entries have attachments without a name. This is a sign of previous database corruption.
Please review attached files in the following entries (and their history): %@
trans-unit.target:
Algunas entradas tienen adjuntos sin nombre. Esta es una señal de daño en la base de datos anterior.
Por favor, revia los archivos adjuntos en las siguientes entradas (y su historial): %@
trans-unit.note: A warning about nameless attachments, shown after loading the database. [listOfEntryNames: String]

alt-trans.target:
Algunas entradas tienen adjuntos sin nombre. Esta es una señal de daño en la base de datos anterior.
Por favor, revise los archivos adjuntos en las siguientes entradas (y su historial): %@

trans-unit.source:
Some entries have custom field(s) with empty names. This can be a sign of data corruption. Please check these entries:
%@
trans-unit.target:
Algunas entradas tienen uno o más campos personalizados con nombres vacíos. Esto puede ser signo de daño en los datos. Por favor, compruebe estas entradas:
%@
trans-unit.note: A warning about misformatted custom fields after loading the database. [entryPaths: String]

trans-unit.source: The database contains some attachments that are not used in any entry. Most likely, they have been forgotten by the last used app (%@). However, this can also be a sign of data corruption. Please make sure to have a backup of your database before changing anything.
trans-unit.target: La base de datos contiene algunos adjuntos que no se utilizan en ninguna entrada. Lo más probable es que hayan sido dejadas por la última aplicación usada (%@). Sin embargo, esto también puede ser un signo de daño en los datos. Por favor, asegúrese de tener una copia de seguridad de su base de datos antes de cambiar nada.
trans-unit.note: A warning about unused attachments after loading the database. [lastUsedAppName: String]

trans-unit.source: Not enough memory to continue. This can happen with larger databases or too ambitious database settings (Argon2 memory parameter).
trans-unit.target: No hay suficiente memoria para continuar. Esto puede ocurrir con bases de datos muy grandes o configuraciones muy exigentes (parámetro de memoria Argon2).
trans-unit.note: Error message when a long-running operation was cancelled due to the lack of free memory (RAM).

alt-trans.target: No hay suficiente memoria para continuar. Esto puede ocurrir con bases de datos muy grandes o configuraciones de base de datos muy exigentes (parámetro de memoria Argon2).

trans-unit.note: Explanation/notification when a long-running operation was cancelled by user
A description/subtitle for Settings/AppLockTimeout options that trigger when the user has been idle for a while. For example: 'AppLock Timeout: 3 seconds (After last interaction)

trans-unit.target: Después de salir de la aplicación
trans-unit.note: A description/subtitle for Settings/AppLock/Timeout options that trigger when the app is minimized. For example: 'AppLock Timeout: 3 seconds (After leaving the app)
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'App Lock: Timeout: Immediately'
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'App Lock: Timeout: Never'
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'App Lock: Timeout: Immediately'
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'App Lock: Timeout: Never'
An option in Settings. Please keep it short. Will be shown as 'Keep Backup Files: Forever'
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'Clipboard Timeout: Never'
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'Clipboard Timeout: Never'
A description/subtitle for the 'DatabaseLockTimeout: Immediately'.
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'Database Lock: Timeout: Immediately'
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'Database Lock: Timeout: Never'
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'Database Lock: Timeout: Immediately'
An option in Settings. Will be shown as 'Database Lock: Timeout: Never'
An option in Group Viewer settings. Refers fo the most recent time when the entry was modified. Will be shown as 'Entry Subtitle: Last Modified Date'.
An option in Group Viewer settings. Will be shown as 'Entry Subtitle: None', meanining that no entry details will be shown in any lists.
An option in Group Viewer settings. Refers to comments/notes field of the entry. Will be shown as 'Entry Subtitle: Notes'.
An option in Group Viewer settings. Will be shown as 'Entry Subtitle: Password'.
An option in Group Viewer settings. Will be shown as 'Entry Subtitle: URL'.
An option in Group Viewer settings. It refers to login information rather than person's name. Will be shown as 'Entry Subtitle: User Name'.

trans-unit.target: Almacenamiento en la nube / Otra aplicación
trans-unit.note: Human-readable file location. The file is situated either online / in cloud storage, or on the same device, but in some other app. Example: 'File Location: Cloud storage / Another app'
Human-readable file location: the file is on device, inside the app sandbox. 'Backup' is a dedicated directory for database backup files. Example: 'File Location: Internal backup'

Human-readable file location: the file is on device, inside the app sandbox. 'Inbox' is a special directory for files that are being imported. Can be also 'Internal import'. Example: 'File Location: Internal inbox'
Human-readable file location: the file is on device, inside the app sandbox. Example: 'File Location: Local copy'
